text: Space Race is the second studio album by New Zealand New Wave music group Mi- Sex, released in May 1980.The album peaked at number one on the New Zealand albums chart and was certified platinum. The record label launched a promotional campaign with the slogan 'Are you a clone? . . . No, I'm in the Space Race'. Little rubber alien mannequins as featured on the front cover popped up all over the place."McFarlane, 'Mi-Sex' entry. Archived from the original on 7 August 2004. Retrieved 7 May 2016. Ed Nimmervoll of Howlspace website felt that the album was "talking about overpopulation, environmental issues, genetic engineering and other issues of great importance for the future." ==Track listing== ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- !Chart (1980) !Peak position |- ! scope="row"|Australian Kent Music Report NOTE: Used for Australian Singles and Albums charting from 1970 until ARIA created their own charts in mid-1988. | style="text-align:center;"|5 |- |- |} ===Year-end charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- !Chart (1980) !Peak position |- ! scope="row"|New Zealand | style="text-align:center;"|9 |- |} ==References== Category:Mi-Sex albums Category:CBS Records albums Category:1980 albums
title: Space Race (album)
